meanings.definition: A person who is blamed for doing something wrong.
examples: Why am I always assumed to be the culprit whenever something goes wrong around here?
It is critical that people take action to stop bullying.

meanings.definition: To be slow to act because of not feeling very sure or willing.
examples: Why are you hesitating? Go ahead and call your friends!

meanings.definition: A way of life; group of people who share a particular way of life.
examples: Our national culture reflects the great diversity of our people.

images.alt: Photo of sculptures on a Singapore temple.
images.description: From the corner of a building and looking upward, parts of two sides of a building are seen. The sides of the building are covered with colorful figures including human figures and dragon shapes.
images.caption: Religion and art are important aspects of human culture.

meanings.definition: A warning of trouble or harm.
examples: After the emperor was died, a threat of war hung over the country.
